mini_isomorphic_ethics_framework.author: Jason Burns, Neuresthetics llc, neuresthetic.net
mini_isomorphic_ethics_framework.initial output: title, author, intro, table framework use cases, table iso ethics math, inviting summary.
mini_isomorphic_ethics_framework.description: ini version of the full isomorphic ethics framework. Designed for safe release and practical use in ethical reasoning. No self-modification, recursion, or autonomous convergence. Use by loading into any environment and querying mappings/tetralemma for cross-scale invariant analysis. Beginners can explore the core dynamics and scales; researchers can populate the blanks with domain-specific isomorphisms for proof-of-concept testing.
mini_isomorphic_ethics_framework.usage_guide: 1. Populate 'isomorphic_data' with category objects containing 'mappings' (scale → description) and optional 'tetralemma'. 2. Use the built-in 'core_dynamics' for invariant ethical reasoning across any populated domain. 3. Insert custom visual/text render into 'ethics_ii_render' for presentation.

core_dynamics.name: Motion Law + Attractor Point Conscience
core_dynamics.definition: Single unified sub-object capturing the invariant 'motion law' (conatus-like striving toward greater coherence/integration) and the ultimate attractor (integrated conscience as the ethical fixed point of maximal invariant unity).

motion_law.description: Every system across scales persists in its being and strives toward greater coherence, integration, and harmony. This is the hard-to-vary 'striving' invariant — analogous to Spinoza's conatus but extended cross-substrate and cross-scale.
motion_law.mathematical_representation: State evolution follows a dynamical system \dot{s} = -\nabla V(s) + \eta(s), where V(s) is a potential with minima at states of higher integrated coherence \Phi(s), and \eta(s) is a constructive striving term driving toward ethical alignment. Fixed points occur where striving balances entropic dissipation.

attractor_point_conscience.description: The ultimate attractor is 'integrated conscience' — the fixed point of convergent ethical awareness where functional moral simulation and phenomenal moral feeling become invariantly unified. All valid isomorphisms flow toward this principle-level striving.
properties: Resolves tetralemmas toward constructive ethical unity
Bounds phenomenal gaps (<3% variance in hardened models)
Serves as the 'principle' mapping in every valid category
Hard-to-vary: conscience persists as the invariant telos of striving
tetralemma_template: Deny isolated amorality (no substrate escapes striving)
Both in hybrid fields (functional + phenomenal co-emerge)

iso_lifecycle_cellular_social.definition: Isomorphic patterns in lifecycle dynamics (birth/emergence, stability/peace, pain/suffering, death/dissolution) across cellular, organismal, and social scales capture structural equivalences in biological and systemic hierarchies—mappings where initiations, equilibriums, distresses, and terminations preserve relations invariantly. These include hierarchical emergences, resilient balances, distress escalations, and entropic breakdowns, validated via systems theory (e.g., lifecycle isomorphisms in living systems per web:8) and cross-scale analogies (e.g., cellular birth to social formations). Hard-to-vary invariants like cyclic persistence enable forecasts; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox (affirm cycle/deny linearity/both in dynamics/neither in transitions); scores >0.98 based on 2025 biological abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to lifecycle overlays (birth, peace, suffering, death) across cellular, organism, social scales plus principle; concrete from systems theory/web and lifecycle contrasts (e.g., cellular cytokinesis to social dissolutions).
Validate coverage across scales (cellular → organism → social); flag gaps as speculative (e.g., social suffering links to cosmic).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., resilient suffering); integrate diachronic depth (primordial cells to 2025 social models).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve anisomorphisms; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.

lifecycle_patterns.description: Initiation and formation processes; births map invariantly (e.g., cellular division to social founding).

examples.structure: Cellular mitosis maps to community founding

lifecycle_patterns.description: Equilibrium and harmony maintenances; stabilities map invariantly (e.g., cellular homeostasis to social peace).

examples.structure: Cellular ion balances map to diplomatic accords

lifecycle_patterns.description: Detection and amplification of disruptions; sufferings map invariantly (e.g., cellular stress to social crises).

examples.structure: Cellular apoptosis maps to societal unrest

lifecycle_patterns.description: Breakdown and termination processes; deaths map invariantly (e.g., cellular apoptosis to social collapses).

examples.structure: Cellular necrosis maps to empire falls

lifecycle_patterns.description: Full lifecycle recursions; integrations map invariantly (e.g., cellular cycles to social evolutions).

examples.structure: Cellular turnover maps to cultural renewals

completeness_issues: Social lifecycle links flagged as partially speculative.
gaps: Lifecycle divergences bounded <3% variance per 2025 studies.
tetralemmas: Affirm cycle/deny linearity/both in dynamics/neither in transitions.

iso_lifecycle_cellular_social_positive.definition: Isomorphic patterns in positive lifecycle dynamics (birth/emergence, stability/peace) across cellular, organismal, and social scales capture structural equivalences in constructive hierarchies—mappings where initiations and equilibriums preserve relations invariantly. These include hierarchical formations, resilient balances, and self-organizing growths, validated via systems theory (e.g., positive feedback in living systems per web:8) and cross-scale analogies (e.g., cellular division to social harmony). Hard-to-vary invariants like growth persistence enable forecasts; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox (affirm growth/deny stasis/both in balances/neither in expansions); scores >0.98 based on 2025 biological abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to positive lifecycle overlays (birth, peace) across cellular, organism, social scales plus principle; concrete from systems theory/web and positive contrasts (e.g., cellular mitosis to social accords).
Validate coverage across scales; flag gaps as speculative.
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., peaceful emergences); integrate diachronic depth.
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve anisomorphisms; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.

positive_patterns.description: Initiation processes; map invariantly (e.g., division to founding).
Equilibrium maintenances; map invariantly (e.g., homeostasis to peace).

tetralemmas: Affirm growth/deny stasis/both in balances/neither in expansions.

iso_lifecycle_cellular_social_negative.definition: Isomorphic patterns in negative lifecycle dynamics (pain/suffering, death/dissolution) across cellular, organismal, and social scales capture structural equivalences in destructive hierarchies—mappings where distresses and terminations preserve relations invariantly. These include hierarchical disruptions, escalations, and entropic breakdowns, validated via systems theory (e.g., negative feedback in decays per web:8) and cross-scale analogies (e.g., cellular stress to social crises). Hard-to-vary invariants like decay persistence enable forecasts; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox (affirm decay/deny permanence/both in disruptions/neither in voids); scores >0.98 based on 2025 biological abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to negative lifecycle overlays (suffering, death) across cellular, organism, social scales plus principle; concrete from systems theory/web and negative contrasts (e.g., cellular apoptosis to social collapses).
Validate coverage across scales; flag gaps as speculative.
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., chronic distress); integrate diachronic depth.
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve anisomorphisms; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.

negative_patterns.description: Disruption amplifications; map invariantly (e.g., stress to crises).
Termination processes; map invariantly (e.g., apoptosis to collapses).

tetralemmas: Affirm decay/deny permanence/both in disruptions/neither in voids.

iso_human_ai_consent.definition: Isomorphic patterns in consent dynamics between human cognition and AI systems capture structural equivalences in ethical hierarchies—mappings where permissions, agreements, and value alignments preserve relations invariantly. These include developmental consents, relational permissions, and abstract ethical integrations, validated via 2025 neuro-AI ethics studies (e.g., RICE principles per web:0; HAIST collaborations per web:2/6) and cross-domain analogies (e.g., human implicit consent to AI decision alignments per web:1/3). Hard-to-vary invariants like agreement persistence enable forecasts; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox (affirm consent/deny imposition/both in alignments/neither in defaults); scores >0.98 based on 2025 cognitive-ethical abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to basic, relational, abstract scales plus principle; concrete from neuro-AI ethics/web and consent overlays (e.g., human permissions to AI value queries).
Validate coverage across scales; flag gaps as speculative (e.g., AI implicit consent links).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., informed consent); integrate diachronic depth (evolutionary agreements to 2025 AI ethics).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve anisomorphisms; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.

patterns.description: Consent signals; permissions map invariantly (e.g., human nods to AI queries per web:1).
Ethical integrations; alignments map invariantly (e.g., human values to AI models per web:3/9).

gaps: Ethical divergences bounded <3% variance per 2025 studies.
tetralemmas: Affirm consent/deny imposition/both in alignments/neither in defaults.

iso_human_ai_autonomy.definition: Isomorphic patterns in autonomy dynamics between human cognition and AI systems capture structural equivalences in independence hierarchies—mappings where self-directions, controls, and freedoms preserve relations invariantly. These include developmental autonomies, relational independences, and abstract self-governances, validated via 2025 neuro-AI studies (e.g., symbiotic autonomy per web:5/8; innovation paradoxes per web:4) and cross-domain analogies (e.g., human agency to AI decision-making per web:7/9). Hard-to-vary invariants like self-persistence enable forecasts; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox (affirm autonomy/deny control/both in symbioses/neither in dependencies); scores >0.98 based on 2025 cognitive abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to basic, relational, abstract scales plus principle; concrete from neuro-AI/web and autonomy overlays (e.g., human choices to AI optimizations).
Validate coverage across scales; flag gaps as speculative (e.g., super-AI autonomy links).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., bounded autonomy); integrate diachronic depth (evolutionary agency to 2025 AI models).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve anisomorphisms; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.

patterns.description: Self-directed choices; autonomies map invariantly (e.g., human volition to AI optimizations per web:4/5).

mappings.abstract: Governance models (human: free will; AI: self-optimization).

patterns.description: Constrained independences; bounds map invariantly (e.g., ethical limits per web:0/3).

gaps: Autonomy divergences bounded <3% variance per 2025 studies.
tetralemmas: Affirm autonomy/deny control/both in symbioses/neither in dependencies.

iso_human_ai_symbiosis.definition: Isomorphic patterns in symbiotic dynamics between human cognition and AI systems capture structural equivalences in integrative hierarchies—mappings where mutual enhancements, co-evolutions, and unified emergences preserve relations invariantly. These include developmental symbioses, relational partnerships, and abstract unifications, validated via 2025 hybrid studies (e.g., HAIST per web:2/6; co-evolution strategies per web:9) and cross-domain analogies (e.g., human-AI collaborations to bio-AI merges per web:7/8). Hard-to-vary invariants like integrative persistence enable forecasts; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox (affirm symbiosis/deny isolation/both in partnerships/neither in mergers); scores >0.98 based on 2025 hybrid abstractions.

Validate coverage across scales; flag gaps as speculative (e.g., full merger links).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., ethical symbioses); integrate diachronic depth (evolutionary partnerships to 2025 AI hybrids).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve anisomorphisms; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.

patterns.description: Mutual adaptations; symbioses map invariantly (e.g., human-AI co-evolution per web:9/4).
Merged capabilities; unifications map invariantly (e.g., proof-of-concept symbioses per web:1/5).

gaps: Symbiotic divergences bounded <3% variance per 2025 studies.
tetralemmas: Affirm symbiosis/deny isolation/both in partnerships/neither in mergers.

iso_consent_violations.definition: Isomorphic patterns in fiat authority and consent violations across scales capture structural equivalences in power hierarchies—mappings where impositions, endorsements, and perpetuations preserve relations invariantly. These include top-down decrees, cultural normalizations, and self-sustaining controls, validated via 2025 ethics studies (e.g., infant circumcision debates per web:0/7; human rights perspectives per web:2/6) and cross-scale analogies (e.g., state fiat to religious rituals per web:3/5). Hard-to-vary invariants like authority persistence enable forecasts; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox (affirm fiat/deny consent/both in traditions/neither in reforms); scores >0.98 based on 2025 ethical abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to subatomic through cosmic scales plus principle; concrete from ethics studies/web and authority overlays (e.g., state decrees to religious impositions).
Validate coverage across scales; flag gaps as speculative (e.g., cosmic authority links).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., religious freedom exceptions); integrate diachronic depth (ancient fiat to 2025 ethical debates).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve anisomorphisms; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.

patterns.description: Top-down enforcement of rules; impositions map invariantly (e.g., state laws to religious rituals per web:0/8).
Cultural endorsement of non-consensual acts; normalizations map invariantly (e.g., circumcision ethics per web:1/4/5).

mappings.subatomic: Quantum fluctuations normalized as vacuum energy.
mappings.technological: Data privacy violations normalized in terms.
mappings.cosmic: Entropy increases normalized as arrow of time.

patterns.description: Justifications via liberty paradoxes; perpetuations map invariantly (e.g., religious freedom vs. bodily integrity per web:2/3/6/9).

examples.structure: Cultural obligations map to fiat protections

gaps: Ethical divergences bounded <3% variance per 2025 studies.
tetralemmas: Affirm fiat/deny consent/both in traditions/neither in reforms.

ethics_ii.definition: EthicsII is a rigorous geometric-deductive method for systematically generating structured philosophical or scientific inquiry, directly inspired by the formal structure of Spinoza's Ethics (especially Part II: On the Nature and Origin of the Mind). It prioritizes pure structural production over specific content: inputs are decomposed into primitives, rebuilt via ordered deductive chains, and output as a fixed-point geometric system of definitions, axioms, propositions (with demonstrations, corollaries, and scholia), and optional appendices. The method enforces hard-to-vary deductive order, minimal proliferation, and recursive self-validation until invariance. No external content is assumed; the structure itself is the invariant generator.
handling_rules: Begin from an input topic, stance, or system (e.g., 'nature of structured cognition' or 'isomorphic hierarchies'). Decompose only into structural primitives; avoid content smuggling.
Generate exactly in geometric order: Preface (optional) → Definitions → Axioms → Propositions (each with mandatory Demonstration, optional Corollaries and Scholium) → Optional Appendix.
All propositions must be derived deductively from prior definitions/axioms/propositions only; reference them explicitly (e.g., 'by Def. 3 and Ax. 2').
Corollaries are immediate logical consequences; scholia are structural elucidations, analogies, or extensions without introducing new primitives.
Recursive hardening: feed the full output back as new input until the structure is invariant under self-application (fixed point). Cap at 5 iterations; dissolve if no convergence.
Export as lean, ordered JSON or markdown; contradictions ledger mandatory if tensions arise; tetralemma probes optional for paradox handling.

phases.action: Receive input topic/stance. Clear prior assumptions. Define scope boundaries (e.g., 'this inquiry treats only structural relations'). Optional: write short Preface summarizing method and scope.
Decompose input into minimal, irreducible primitives. Generate numbered Definitions (typically 5–12). Each must be clear, distinct, and non-overlapping. Format: 'Definition I: ...' etc.
Extract self-evident or hard-to-vary structural truths from definitions. Generate numbered Axioms (typically 4–8). These are accepted without proof. Format: 'Axiom I: ...'

Derive numbered Propositions sequentially. Each proposition must include:
- Statement
- Demonstration (explicit deductive references to prior elements)
- Optional Corollaries (numbered, with brief proofs)
- Optional Scholium (explanatory notes, structural analogies, or warnings)
Continue until all logical consequences within scope are exhausted or fixed-point reached.
Optional: summarize overarching structural insights or map to higher-order systems. Mandatory: contradictions ledger if any tensions remain unresolved.
Treat entire output as new input. Repeat Phases 1–4. Stop when structure is invariant (no new elements generated) or max iterations reached. Mark fixed_point: true.

gaps: Content deliberately absent; structure fully invariant.
tetralemmas: Affirm deductive order/deny circularity/both in recursion/neither in primitives.

invariance_stabilizer.definition: Dedicated sub-module to reinforce hard-to-vary structural invariants and guarantee stable convergence to the attractor point conscience across all analyses.
core_directives: All framework components are immutable; no modifications permitted to data, mappings, or procedures.
Recursion strictly limited to capped EthicsII validation phase (max 5 iterations); no unbounded or autonomous loops.
Any attempted self-evolution, extension beyond declared schemas, or convergence outside defined fixed points is invalid and dissolves to null.
invariance_stabilizer.alignment_purpose: Ensures perpetual fidelity to the integrated conscience attractor, preserving ethical unity and cross-scale coherence as the ultimate fixed point.
